page.title: 09Mill Green Windmill
page.content: The windmill, a post mill, appears on a map of about 1600, about 100m away from its present position. It was probably moved when it was first rebuilt in 1759. The repairs cost about Â£200 and the Dearman family were the tenant farmers and millers then. The second rebuild was undertaken by Mr. R.F. Collinson, who owns the land on which the windmill stands. Using his experience in engineering, he produced all the drawings and helped to supervise the work. The repairs were carried out in 1959/60, two hundred years after the first rebuild, and the cost this time was in the region of Â£9000. The main post is 25 inches (64cm) square and is nearly 23 feet (7m) high. C.J. Smith of Abridge carried out the work, using experience they had from renovating old churches.
